titles.title: Senior Citizens Protection Act of 1987
A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide penalties for assaults against the elderly that result in medical expenses paid by the United States.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Senior Citizens Protection Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal criminal code to establish criminal penalties for persons who assault elderly individuals (over 62 years of age) and cause medical damages of more than $100 paid under title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act.
